text:
View 1: Joyce Kilmer Park, Bronx. Looking north from East 161 Street and Grand Concourse, showing the Heinrich Heine statue in the foreground.
View 2: Another view of the Park, from E. 162 St., after it had been rebuilt by the W.P.A.

View 1: May 16, 1928
P. L. Sperr, photographer
View 2: May 11, 1937
W.P.A. photo, Five Boroughs Project
title: Bronx: 161st Street (East) - Grand Concourse

text:
View 1: Joyce Kilmer Park, Bronx. Looking north from East 161 Street and Grand Concourse, showing the Heinrich Heine statue in the foreground.
View 2: Another view of the Park, from E. 162 St., after it had been rebuilt by the W.P.A.

View 1: May 16, 1928
P. L. Sperr, photographer
View 2: May 11, 1937
W.P.A. photo, Five Boroughs Project
title: Bronx: 161st Street (East) - Grand Concourse

text:
Grand Concourse (running from extreme right foreground to center background), north from and including East 161st to a point north of 164th Streets. In the foreground is East 161st Street from Grand Concourse to Walton Ave. and part of Joyce Kilmer Park.

July 7, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 161st Street (East)

text:
Walton Ave. (left), north from and including East 161st Street. Also shown, under construction is Joyce Kilmer Park. On the extreme right appears part of Grand Concourse.

July 7, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
